declarations.comments:
Execute query and parse rows using yoga-json's ReadForeign (DEFAULT)
Throws parse errors to the Om exception channel
declarations.title: execute

declarations.comments:
Execute query with options and parse rows using yoga-json's ReadForeign
Throws parse errors to the Om exception channel
declarations.title: executeWithOptions

declarations.comments:
Execute query and unsafeCoerce rows to the desired type (bypasses yoga-json parsing)
USE WITH CAUTION - no runtime validation!
declarations.title: executeUnsafe

declarations.comments:
Create a ScyllaDB layer that provides Client as a service
Requires ScyllaDBConfig in context
declarations.title: scyllaLayer

declarations.comments:
Create a ScyllaDB layer with inline config
Useful when you don't need config from context
declarations.title: scyllaLayer'

declarations.comments: Helper to avoid the annoying ({} :: {}) pattern
declarations.title: noContext

declarations.comments:
Execute query and parse rows using yoga-json's ReadForeign (DEFAULT)
Automatically gets Client from Om context
Throws parse errors to the Om exception channel
declarations.title: execute

declarations.comments:
Execute query with options and parse rows using yoga-json's ReadForeign
Automatically gets Client from Om context
Throws parse errors to the Om exception channel
declarations.title: executeWithOptions

declarations.comments:
Execute query and unsafeCoerce rows to the desired type (bypasses yoga-json parsing)
Automatically gets Client from Om context
USE WITH CAUTION - no runtime validation!
declarations.title: executeUnsafe

declarations.comments:
Execute a typed CQL query in Om context
Automatically gets Client from Om context
Throws parse errors to the Om exception channel
declarations.title: executeSql

declarations.comments: Execute a typed CQL query and return a single row in Om context
declarations.title: executeSqlOne

declarations.comments: Execute a mutation in Om context
declarations.title: executeMutation
